snippet: The mayor of New Orleans said Friday that the city had agreed to pay $75 million to settle a dispute with firefighters over back wages.
abstract: New Orleans Mayor Mitch Landrieu says city has agreed to pay firefighters $75 million in back wages in order to settle long-running dispute in which he was threatened with house arrest.
lead_paragraph: The mayor of New Orleans said Friday that the city had agreed to pay $75 million to settle a dispute with firefighters over back wages.

headline.main: Louisiana: Deal Reached on Firefighters’ Back Pay
headline.print_headline: Louisiana: Deal Reached on Firefighters’ Back Pay
